Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the exterior is covered with a pale red-brown slip and faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394400) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394400)
